column4: Is there any windows manager that can help me automatically set a window as "all desktops"?
openbox
do you know if open box can help me set a window as "all desktops" but only when it is placed on my second monitor?
not sure, only have one monitor here
ok
thanks
yes?
why
'cause upgrading ubuntu always feels good :)
what does it offer that you currently need
nothing at all, i think. But i just like to upgrade.
what os are you currently using?
gentoo on desktop, arch on netbook, debian on server
get rid of pulseaudio
get rid of pulseaudio
sudo apt-get remove pulseadio?
aptitude purge pulseaudio
will this have any consequences? (besides fixing my problem)
you'll be using ALSA instead, which in my opinion is much better and doesn't have these problems
what about skype? do you know if it works with alsa?
i don't know offhand since i don't use skype sorry
ok, thank you for your help!
that didn't fix my problem though :/
